decision_conditions: The replacement tree must be planted on or near the existing tree by April 2025; the tree T1 Horse Chestnut should be replaced with a native tree of either Betula pendula, Carpinus betulis or Acer campestre. T2 Prunus should be replaced by another Prunus of your choice, and both replacements must be of a size not less than 10-12cm girth when planted.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
TPO CH07; TPO CH08; TPO CH09 
T1  Common Horse Chestnut - Fell in sections to ground level. 
T2 Cherry - Fell in sections to ground level. 	
G1  Bay x 2 - Lift the low hanging branches over the road to approx. 4 metres; cut back from the street lamp to allow 2 metres clearance. 
T3  Hornbeam - Lift low hanging branches over the public footpath to allow 3 metres clearance; lift low hanging branches.
T4  Willow - Remove all regrowth back to the previous pruning points; remove approx. 1 metre of timber from the knuckle ends.
